title: Calls for legislative conference committees; requires appropriate legislative committee to act on a bill if requested by the sponsor of the bill
summary: Calls for legislative conference committees; requires appropriate legislative committee to act on a bill if requested by the sponsor of the bill.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2553

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 19, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. PRETLOW -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Governmental Operations

                   CONCURRENT RESOLUTION OF THE SENATE AND ASSEMBLY

       proposing an amendment to section 12 of article 3 of  the  constitution,
         in relation to conference committees

    1    Section 1. Resolved (if the Senate concur), That section 12 of article
    2  3  of the constitution be amended by adding a new undesignated paragraph
    3  to read as follows:
    4    UPON THE ENGROSSMENT OF A BILL IN A DIFFERENT FORM BY BOTH  HOUSES,  A
    5  CONFERENCE COMMITTEE SHALL BE FORMED BY APPOINTMENT OF FOUR MEMBERS FROM
    6  EACH  HOUSE  BY  THE PRESIDING OFFICERS THEREOF TO SERVE ON A CONFERENCE
    7  COMMITTEE. THE COMMITTEE SHALL ENDEAVOR TO REACH  A  COMPROMISE  BETWEEN
    8  THE TWO DRAFT BILLS, AND MAY ONLY DELIBERATE ON THOSE ISSUES THAT DIFFER
    9  IN THE DRAFTS ENGROSSED BY THE TWO HOUSES. THE COMMITTEE'S DELIBERATIONS
   10  SHALL  TAKE PLACE IN PUBLIC FORUM, AND IT SHALL REPORT THE RESULT OF ITS
   11  DELIBERATIONS IN THE FORM OF A BILL. A NEW DRAFT BILL RESULTING FROM THE
   12  COMMITTEE'S DELIBERATIONS MAY RECEIVE A NEW BILL NUMBER.  ANY  ITEMS  OF
   13  APPROPRIATION IN A NEW OR AMENDED BILL MAY NOT EXCEED THE HIGHER OF SUCH
   14  ITEMS  FROM  EITHER  OF  THE  SEPARATELY ENGROSSED BILLS.   REPORTS OF A
   15  CONFERENCE COMMITTEE CANNOT BE CHANGED OR AMENDED BY EITHER  HOUSE,  BUT
   16  MUST  BE  ACCEPTED  OR  REJECTED  IN  WHOLE,  IN THE FORM IN WHICH MADE.
   17  REJECTION OF A CONFERENCE COMMITTEE REPORT BY BOTH HOUSES  SHALL  RESULT
   18  IN THE CREATION OF A NEW CONFERENCE COMMITTEE COMPOSED IN THE MANNER SET
   19  FORTH ABOVE, WHICH MAY MAKE ANY ALTERATIONS NECESSARY TO REACH AGREEMENT
   20  BETWEEN  THE  TWO  ENGROSSED BILLS, AND REPORT ITS DELIBERATIONS TO BOTH
   21  HOUSES FOR THE QUESTION UPON ITS FINAL PASSAGE.
   22    S 2. Resolved (if the Senate concur), That the foregoing amendments be
   23  referred to the first regular legislative session  convening  after  the
   24  next  succeeding  general  election  of members of the assembly, and, in
   25  conformity with  section  1  of  article  19  of  the  constitution,  be
   26  published for 3 months previous to the time of such election.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD89092-01-1
actClause: Concurrent Resolution of the Senate and Assembly proposing an amendment to section 12 of article 3 of the constitution, in relation to conference committees
